Class Canvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  Canvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Canvas
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Canvas is used to draw all predefined store components given to it. The canvas does not calculate the location of components other than relative to each other in special cases, only draws then outputs to screen.

Version:
2011,03,18
Author:
Greg Myers
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Canvas

public Canvas()
Constructor for objects of class Canvas. Creates a frame with a content pant of a panel and ovverides that panel to draw an image generated by the abstract graphics class.

Method Detail

addShopFloor

public void addShopFloor(java.awt.Dimension size,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> aisles,
                         java.awt.Dimension checkoutArea,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> checkouts,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> customers)
adds a shop floor area, calls methods to add all other elements.

Parameters:
size - the size of the shop floor.
aisles - the location of impassable aisles on the shop floor.
checkoutArea - the size of the checkout area.
checkouts - contains the customers in the queues.
customers - contains the coordinates of the customers on the shop floor.

erase

public void erase()
Fills the default image size with black. Will not respond to resizing the window. Will take effect on the next panel repaint to minimize flickering.
